products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-ocp-ai
products.label: Cloud automation for Red Hat OpenShift AI
products.short_description: Deploy a Red Hat OpenShift cluster on Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) pre-configured with AI capabilities for accelerated machine learning workloads
products.long_description: This automation streamlines the deployment of Red Hat OpenShift cluster on IBM Cloud with the OpenShift AI add-on. It accelerates the setup of machine learning environments by leveraging the capabilities of the OpenShift AI add-on with GPU-enabled clusters, reducing the complexity of AI infrastructure management and allowing data scientists and developers to focus on model development and deployment. Learn more about [Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-getting-started) and the [OpenShift AI add-on](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-ai-addon-about). Refer [here](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/containers?topic=containers-supported-cluster-addon-versions#openshift-ai-416) for the supported OpenShift AI add-on versions.

features.title: Red Hat OpenShift Cluster
features.description: Creates and configures a GPU-enabled Red Hat OpenShift cluster on a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) to enable the installation of the OpenShift AI Add-on for integrating advanced artificial intelligence capabilities. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-cluster-create-vpc-gen2&interface=ui).

features.title: OpenShift AI Add-on
features.description: Automates the provisioning of an OpenShift AI add-on on the Red Hat OpenShift cluster on IBM Cloud. This includes optimized configurations for machine learning frameworks and simplified deployment of AI-driven applications. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-ai-addon-install&interface=ui).

features.title: Virtual Private Cloud
features.description: Configures a [Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/vpc?topic=vpc-getting-started&interface=cli#create-and-configure-vpc) network to deploy the OpenShift cluster.

features.title: Object Storage
features.description: Configures an [Object Storage](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-storage-cos-understand) for OpenShift internal registry storage. You can provide an existing instance or use the [Cloud automation for Object Storage](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-cos-68921490-2778-4930-ac6d-bae7be6cd958-global) for creating a new instance.

features.title: Key encryption
features.description: Optionally you can integrate key encryption such as [Key Protect](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/openshift?topic=openshift-encryption-setup&interface=ui), [Hyper Protect Crypto Services](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/services/hyper-protect-crypto-services) to encrypt the OpenShift cluster and its boot volumes.

features.title: Secrets Manager
features.description: Optional integration with [Cloud automation for Secrets Manager](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-secrets-manager-6d6ebc76-7bbd-42f5-8bc7-78f4fabd5944-global) for centrally managing Ingress subdomain certificates.

features.title: Security and Compliance Alignment
features.description: Advanced configurations include features such as [audit logging](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/containers?topic=containers-health-audit#audit-api-server) and encryption key management, and may align with [IBM Cloud Framework for Financial Services](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/framework-financial-services?topic=framework-financial-services-about) for production use in regulated environments.

features.title: Sets up logging for the OpenShift cluster
features.description: Optionally, you can deploy [Cloud automation for Cloud Logs](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-cloud-logs-63d8ae58-fbf3-41ce-b844-0fb5b85882ab-global) to route, alert, and visualize platform logs that are generated by your OpenShift cluster.

features.title: Sets up monitoring operational metrics for the OpenShift cluster
features.description: Optionally, you can deploy [Cloud automation for Cloud Monitoring](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-cloud-monitoring-73debdbf-894f-4c14-81c7-5ece3a70b67d-global) to measure how users and applications interact with your OpenShift cluster.

features.title: Sets up activity tracking for the OpenShift cluster
features.description: Optionally, you can deploy [Cloud automation for Activity Tracker Event Routing](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-activity-tracker-918453c3-4f97-4583-8c4a-83ef12fc7916-global) to route and securely store auditing events that are related to your OpenShift cluster.

products.support_details: This product is in the community registry, support is handled through the [original repo](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-ocp-ai). If you experience issues kindly open an issue [here](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-ocp-ai/issues). Please note that this product is not currently supported through the IBM Cloud Support Center.

diagram.caption: Red Hat OpenShift cluster on IBM Cloud with the OpenShift AI add-on - Fully configurable

diagrams.description:
This deployable architecture illustrates the deployment of a GPU-enabled Red Hat OpenShift cluster on IBM Cloud with the OpenShift AI add-on, showcasing the key components and their interactions for AI workloads support.

You can create a fully-configured VPC by selecting the [Cloud automation for VPC](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-vpc-2af61763-f8ef-4527-a815-b92166f29bc8-global) component or you can use an existing VPC. The VPC can be provisioned either in a single-zone or multi-zone configuration, depending on your availability requirements. The default configuration deploys a VPC with three zone subnets, configures the predefined ACLs, and attaches a public gateway with one of the subnets.

To utilize the capabilities of OpenShift AI, you must configure at least one GPU-enabled node within your cluster. The architecture supports a flexible compute environment, allowing you to deploy a mix of GPU and non-GPU nodes across different worker pools. This solution offers two worker pools that are spread across all three zones, with the OpenShift AI add-on set as the default configuration.

A Cloud Object Storage (COS) instance is required for the OpenShift cluster, which serves as the internal registry storage for the OpenShift cluster. The [Cloud automation for Object Storage](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-cos-68921490-2778-4930-ac6d-bae7be6cd958-global) deployable architecture can be used to create a COS instance.
Additionally, the storage bucket can be encrypted using Key Management Services(KMS) to encrypt the cluster and the boot volumes used by the cluster to enhance security.

It can be integrated with Observability services such as [Cloud automation for Cloud Monitoring](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-cloud-monitoring-73debdbf-894f-4c14-81c7-5ece3a70b67d-global) to provide robust monitoring capabilities and capture essential metrics such as CPU and memory utilization, to help you proactively monitor system performance and resource consumption, [Cloud automation for Activity Tracker Event Routing](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-activity-tracker-918453c3-4f97-4583-8c4a-83ef12fc7916-global) to monitor how users and applications interact with the cluster, to support compliance and auditability, and [Cloud automation for Cloud Logs](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-cloud-logs-63d8ae58-fbf3-41ce-b844-0fb5b85882ab-global) to collect, view, and analyze platform logs related to the cluster and logs generated by applications deployed on the cluster.

Secrets Manager Integration can also be enabled by using [Cloud automation for Secrets Manager](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-secrets-manager-6d6ebc76-7bbd-42f5-8bc7-78f4fabd5944-global) for centrally managing Ingress subdomain certificates, ensuring the secure management of sensitive credentials.

This architecture provides a robust and secure foundation for deploying and managing your AI workloads on Red Hat OpenShift cluster, enabling seamless integration, enhanced security, and comprehensive monitoring for your applications.

diagram.caption: Red Hat OpenShift cluster on IBM Cloud with the OpenShift AI add-on  - QuickStart

diagrams.description:
This deployable Architecture deploys a GPU-enabled Red Hat OpenShift cluster with the OpenShift AI add-on on IBM Cloud. It streamlines the provisioning of all required components , allowing you to get started with AI workloads quickly and efficiently. The architecture includes a pre-configured Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) with a single-zone, single-subnet layout forming the foundation for your OpenShift cluster. The architecture supports a flexible compute environment, allowing you to deploy a mix of GPU and non-GPU nodes across different worker pools. This solution offers two worker pools in a single zone, with the OpenShift AI add-on enabled by default. It deploys the IBM-managed OpenShift AI operator for AI/ML workloads.

A Cloud Object Storage (COS) instance is required for the OpenShift cluster, which serves as the internal registry storage for the OpenShift cluster.
